intro: Phalangium spicatum, commonly known as the spiky phalangium, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are often brightly colored, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The spiky foliage serves as a defense mechanism against herbivores.
